The effects were linked to changes in microbial communities and soil properties.
population_specificity: Pepper monocropping soils

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of PQQ on cellular proliferation, apoptosis resistance, mitochondrial and metabolic dysfunctions, and pulmonary hypertension (PH) development in both in vitro and in vivo models.
results_summary: PQQ treatment attenuated cellular proliferation, promoted apoptosis via mitochondrial pathways, improved mitochondrial bioenergetics, reduced insulin resistance, and significantly mitigated PH symptoms in rats, including right ventricle pressure, hypertrophy, endothelial dysfunction, and pulmonary artery remodeling.
population_specificity: Human pulmonary artery smooth muscle cells (HPASMCs), endothelial cells (PAECs), primary cultured cardiomyocytes, and Sprague Dawley rats with monocrotaline-induced PH.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the antioxidant effect of PQQ on ROS formation caused by α-syn-119 in the presence of Cu(II) and its potential to prevent α-syn-119 fibrillation.
results_summary: PQQ effectively prevented ROS formation in SH-SY5Y human differentiated neuronal cells and actively inhibited α-syn-119 fibrillation in the presence of Cu(II), as confirmed by multiple chemical techniques.
population_specificity: SH-SY5Y human differentiated neuronal cells (in vitro study).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ dietary supplementation protects against alkylating agent-induced ovarian dysfunction in mice.
results_summary: PQQ treatment increased ovarian weight and size, partially normalized disrupted estrous cycles, prevented follicle loss, and significantly improved pregnancy rates and litter size in mice treated with alkylating agents. The protective effects were linked to promoting cell proliferation, inhibiting apoptosis and senescence, and reducing oxidative stress and inflammation.
population_specificity: Female mice with induced ovarian dysfunction via alkylating agents (busulphan and cyclophosphamide).
study_duration: Started 1 week before model establishment until sacrifice (exact duration not specified beyond 3 months post-treatment).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore PQQ's role in sepsis and determine the molecular function of CUL3 in sepsis pathogenesis, focusing on its effects on acute liver injury, inflammation, oxidative stress, and apoptosis.
results_summary: PQQ treatment alleviated acute liver injury, inflammation, oxidative stress, and apoptosis in sepsis rats and LPS-induced Kupffer cells. PQQ downregulated CUL3 expression, which was linked to its protective effects.
population_specificity: Sepsis model rats and LPS-treated Kupffer cells (in vitro).
study_duration: 2-hour pretreatment followed by 24-hour LPS exposure (in vitro).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of PQQ on semen quality and oxidative stress mitigation in cryopreserved bull sperm.
results_summary: PQQ at 100 μmol/L significantly improved sperm motility, membrane integrity, and acrosome integrity while reducing oxidative stress markers (MDA, ROS) and increasing ATP levels. It also preserved key antioxidant proteins (PGAM2, CAPZB, CAT, SOD1, GPX1) post freeze-thawing.
population_specificity: Holstein bull semen samples
effective_dosage: 50 μmol/L, 100 μmol/L, 150 μmol/L (single treatment prior to cryopreservation)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether combining PQQ with clozapine could enhance NMDA receptor function and improve cognitive ability in a schizophrenia model.
results_summary: The combination of PQQ and clozapine improved MK-801-induced schizophrenia behaviors, including cognitive impairment, by modulating NMDA receptors and reducing hippocampal tau hyperphosphorylation via the Akt/GSK-3β pathway.
population_specificity: MK-801-induced schizophrenia model rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of pyrroloquinoline quinone disodium (PQQ·Na2) on reproductive performance in sows.
results_summary: Dietary PQQ·Na2 supplementation significantly improved reproductive outcomes, including increased total piglets born, live births, and litter weight, while also enhancing antioxidant status in the placenta, plasma, and milk. RNA-seq analysis revealed differential gene expression linked to reproduction-related pathways.
population_specificity: Gestating and lactating sows

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate whether PQQ could attenuate denervation-induced skeletal muscle atrophy and explore its underlying molecular mechanisms.
results_summary: PQQ significantly reduced proinflammatory cytokines (IL-6, IL-1β, TNF-α), attenuated signaling pathways (Jak2/STAT3, TGF-β1/Smad3, JNK/p38 MAPK, NF-κB), and mitigated muscle atrophy, mitophagy, and fiber type transition in denervated mice.
population_specificity: Mice with sciatic nerve transection (denervation-induced skeletal muscle atrophy).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether esterification of PQQ (PQQ-TME) improves its blood-brain barrier permeability and enhances its inhibitory effects on amyloid oligomer formation.
results_summary: PQQ-TME demonstrated twice the BBB permeability of PQQ in vitro and showed greater inhibitory activity against fibrillation of α-synuclein, Aβ1-42, and prion protein, suggesting esterification as a promising approach for PQQ-based amyloid inhibitors.
population_specificity: In vitro study (no human or animal subjects specified).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether prenatal PQQ supplementation could protect offspring from NAFLD progression in a mouse model of maternal diet-induced obesity.
results_summary: PQQ supplementation reduced liver lipids, oxidative stress, and proinflammatory gene expression while increasing metabolic flexibility and fatty acid oxidation, with effects persisting after weaning.
population_specificity: Mouse offspring exposed to maternal obesity and Western-style diet.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to enhance the production of 6NSL (a precursor for diabetes therapy) by improving the activity of mSLDH in G. oxydans through PQQ supplementation.
results_summary: The study found that supplementing with four amino acids involved in PQQ biosynthesis increased extracellular PQQ levels by 1.49-fold, which further enhanced mSLDH activity by 1.33-fold, leading to high 6NSL production (184.28 g·L⁻¹).
population_specificity: Bacterial strain G. oxydans ZJB-605 (in vitro study).
effective_dosage: Not specified (combined supplementation of Glu, Ile, Ser, Arg).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to identify bacterial strains with quorum quenching (QQ) activity and evaluate the potential of strain PQQ-42 (Alteromonas stellipolaris) to degrade AHLs and reduce virulence in Vibrio species.
results_summary: Strain PQQ-42 degraded a wide range of AHLs, reduced protease and chitinase production, and inhibited swimming motility in Vibrio species. In biocontrol experiments, it significantly reduced tissue damage in corals infected with Vibrio mediterranei.
population_specificity: Bacterial strains from a bivalve hatchery and coral (Oculina patagonica).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ could improve neuronal functions and provide neuroprotection in adult rats following intracerebral hemorrhage (ICH).
results_summary: PQQ pretreatment at 10 mg/kg improved locomotor functions, reduced hematoma volumes, and mitigated brain edema after ICH. It also decreased reactive oxygen species production and oxidative stress markers while reducing caspase-3 activation, suggesting potential neuroprotective effects.
population_specificity: Adult rats with experimentally induced intracerebral hemorrhage.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ-producing EcN could mitigate oxidative stress and mitochondrial dysfunction in ageing rats and rotenone-induced stress models.
results_summary: PQQ-producing EcN-5 treatment reduced oxidative stress markers, improved mitochondrial function, and lowered lipid levels in ageing and rotenone-treated rats, with effects comparable to direct PQQ supplementation.
population_specificity: Adult (16-18 weeks) and ageing (48-50 weeks) rats.
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg diet (daily) for PQQ; 10^8 CFU (twice weekly) for EcN strains.
study_duration: 28 days for rotenone-induced stress model; 8 months for ageing model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the subchronic oral toxicity of PQQ disodium salt in rats to determine its safety profile and identify any adverse effects.
results_summary: The study found no mortality or toxicologically significant changes in clinical signs, body weight, food consumption, necropsy findings, or organ weights. Differences in some hematological and serum biochemical parameters were not considered treatment-related, and the NOAEL was determined to be 400 mg/kg bw/day.
population_specificity: Sprague-Dawley rats (10 rats/sex/group)
effective_dosage: 100, 200, and 400 mg/kg bw/day administered by gavage

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the anti-inflammatory effects of PQQ in LPS-treated primary microglia cells and its potential to alleviate neuroinflammation in an acute inflammation murine brain model.
results_summary: PQQ significantly inhibited the production of pro-inflammatory mediators (NO, PGE2, iNOS, COX-2, TNF-a, IL-1b, IL-6, MCP-1, MIP-1a) and suppressed NF-κB nuclear translocation and MAP kinase pathways in microglia. In vivo, PQQ attenuated neuroinflammation and protected neurons against microglia-mediated neurotoxicity.
population_specificity: Primary microglia cells and a murine (mouse) acute inflammation brain model.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the synergistic effect of a probiotic E. coli strain containing PQQ gene cluster on oxidative stress induced by DMH in rats.
results_summary: The study found that the probiotic with PQQ gene cluster increased fecal PQQ concentration, reduced lipid peroxidation, and restored antioxidant enzyme activities in liver and colonic tissues. It also provided significant histological protection in the colon.
population_specificity: Adult virgin Charles Foster male rats (3-4 months old, weighing 200-250 g).
effective_dosage: Not specified for PQQ alone; probiotic dose details not provided.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ improves behavioral and histological outcomes in adult rats following reversible middle cerebral artery occlusion (rMCAo).
results_summary: PQQ at 10 mg/kg and 3 mg/kg significantly reduced cerebral infarct volumes and improved neurobehavioral scores when administered at the initiation or 3 hours after rMCAo, while 1 mg/kg was ineffective.
population_specificity: Adult rats subjected to reversible middle cerebral artery occlusion (rMCAo).
effective_dosage: 10 mg/kg, 3 mg/kg, and 1 mg/kg, administered once intravenously.
study_duration: Single administration at initiation or 3 hours post-rMCAo, with outcomes measured 72 hours later.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the performance of a glucose biosensor using PQQ-dependent glucose dehydrogenase (GDH) and chromium hexacyanoferrate (CrHCF) for glucose detection.
results_summary: The biosensor demonstrated linear amperometric measurement up to 20 mM glucose (R = 0.9923) with a sensitivity of 199.94 nA/mM per cm² and remained stable for over 270 days. The potential treatment of CrHCF enabled effective glucose detection.
population_specificity: Not applicable (in vitro study on a biosensor system).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the acid-treatment effects on PQQ detection using electron ionization mass spectroscopy and explore its tautomeric lactonization and oxidation-reduction behavior.
results_summary: Acid-treatment facilitated PQQ detection, revealing molecular ions and base ions consistent with lactonization and redox reactions. The study also identified deuterated products and quinoxaline adduct formation, supporting the proposed mechanisms.
population_specificity: Not specified (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to measure PQQ levels, identify its presence in biological samples, and explore its potential role in oxidative stress and redox metabolism.
results_summary: The study found that PQQ can be measured at picomole levels, is present in egg yolk and milk, and may catalyze superoxide formation in damaged tissues, suggesting a role in oxidative stress. PQQ also contributes to redox metabolism and structural integrity of cells and tissues.
population_specificity: Not specified (general biological samples and theoretical pathological tissues)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ could restore lysyl oxidase activity and collagen extractability in chick embryos treated with lathyrogens, compared to pyridoxal.
results_summary: PQQ treatment was less effective than pyridoxal in restoring lysyl oxidase activity and collagen extractability in chick embryos. The study suggests pyridoxal derivatives may be required for enzyme formation, either as cofactors or due to pyridoxal-dependent enzyme processes.
population_specificity: Chick embryos

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if PQQ is cardioprotective in rat models of ischemia and ischemia/reperfusion injury.
results_summary: PQQ significantly reduced infarct size, improved cardiac function, and decreased lipid peroxidation in both ischemia and ischemia/reperfusion models. It also reduced ventricular fibrillation episodes and showed dose-dependent efficacy, with 15 mg/kg being the optimal dose without renal or hepatic toxicity.
population_specificity: Rats subjected to left anterior descending (LAD) coronary artery ligation (ischemia) or ischemia/reperfusion.
effective_dosage: 5-20 mg/kg, administered intraperitoneally (i.p.) 30 min before occlusion or intravenously (i.v.) at reperfusion onset.
study_duration: Acute intervention (2 hours of ischemia or 17-30 min occlusion followed by 2 hours reperfusion).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether PQQ acts as a covalently bound cofactor in the catalytic cycle of pig kidney dopa decarboxylase and its interplay with pyridoxal phosphate (PLP).
results_summary: The study found that PQQ is covalently bound to the enzyme, with 1 PQQ molecule per enzyme, and interacts with PLP during catalysis. It also suggested that other PLP-containing enzymes may similarly function as pyridoxo-quinoproteins.
population_specificity: Pig kidney enzyme (in vitro study)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine how PQQ affects cellular redox status and cytotoxicity in human leukemia cells, specifically examining its interaction with glutathione and reactive oxygen species.
results_summary: PQQ induced apoptosis in U937 cells by depleting glutathione and increasing reactive oxygen species. Glutathione supplementation or depletion altered PQQ's cytotoxicity, either enhancing apoptosis or switching cell death to necrosis.
population_specificity: Human promonocytic leukemia U937 cells (in vitro study).
interactions: Interaction with glutathione and N-acetyl-L-cysteine noted.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the impact of dihydrogen and PQQ supplementation on mitochondrial biomarkers, brain metabolism, and cognition in elderly individuals with mild cognitive impairment.
results_summary: Dihydrogen-PQQ significantly increased serum BDNF levels and cerebral oxygenation, improved orientation in cognitive tests, and elevated brain N-acetyl aspartate levels in multiple regions. However, the study noted a limited sample size for clinical interpretation.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals (mean age 71.9 ± 3.8 years, 28 females) with mild cognitive impairment.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore PQQ's role as an enzymatic cofactor or accessory factor and its mechanisms of action, particularly in mitochondrial function and potential therapeutic benefits.
results_summary: PQQ deficiency reduces mitochondrial content and related gene expression, while supplementation enhances NAD+-dependent sirtuin activity and mitochondrial functions. PQQ shows potential benefits in metabolic flexibility, immuno-and neuroprotection, and attenuation of dysfunctions like ischemia and inflammation.
population_specificity: Neonatal or perinatal models (animal studies inferred).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the effect of PQQ disodium salt (BioPQQ™) on cognitive functions, particularly attention and working memory, in elderly healthy subjects.
results_summary: PQQ supplementation significantly reduced Stroop interference ratios compared to placebo and improved visual-spatial cognitive function in subjects with lower initial scores. No adverse events were reported, and preliminary data suggested increased cerebral blood flow in the prefrontal cortex.
population_specificity: 41 elderly healthy subjects

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate Pramiracetam's potential antiamnesic properties in scopolamine-induced amnesia in healthy volunteers.
results_summary: Pramiracetam partially reduced scopolamine-induced amnesic effects in both young and old subjects, particularly in episodic memory and selective attention, while visuo-motor and incidental learning measures remained unaffected.
population_specificity: Healthy males aged 18-42 and 55-65 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of pramiracetam on choline transport across the blood-brain barrier and cerebral blood flow in rats treated with scopolamine.
results_summary: Pramiracetam prevented scopolamine-induced increases in choline extraction and permeability-surface area product, while also increasing cerebral blood flow. Regional differences in choline transport and blood flow were observed, suggesting pramiracetam may modulate brain choline metabolism.
population_specificity: Male Wistar rats

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the antidementia efficacy of pramiracetam in patients with probable Alzheimer's disease using a placebo-controlled, enrichment-type trial design.
results_summary: The study found that pramiracetam showed limited efficacy, with only two out of eight patients demonstrating improvement in the replication phase. PET scans in two individuals showed no definite change, and doses up to 4,000 mg were deemed unlikely to confer symptomatic benefit.
population_specificity: 10 patients with probable Alzheimer's disease.
effective_dosage: Up to 4,000 mg pramiracetam (specific frequency not mentioned).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether Maheshwarananda's modified bhujangini pranayama yoga breathing technique could mitigate hypobaric hypoxemia at high altitude (3,650 m).
results_summary: Pranayama breathing significantly increased arterial oxygen saturation (SpO2) at high altitude compared to normal resting breathing, with no significant changes in heart rate or end-tidal CO2. The breathing rate during pranayama was slower (7/min) than during normal resting breathing (13/min).
population_specificity: 20 nonsmoking, lacto-vegetarian, alcohol-abstaining individuals with daily pranayama practice, divided into two groups of 10.
study_duration: Measurements taken at baseline (378 m) and on the 2nd (T1) and 4th (T2) days at 3,650 m.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the efficacy of bee-humming respiratory training (BHRT), a pranayama breathing technique, on tinnitus-related measures and cardiovascular/respiratory autonomic functions in elderly individuals with chronic subjective tinnitus.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in tinnitus loudness, annoyance, handicap inventory scores, and improvements in cardiovascular/respiratory autonomic functions in the BHRT group, with no significant changes observed in the control group.
population_specificity: Elderly individuals (aged ≥65 years) with bilateral chronic subjective tinnitus.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the physiological rationale and clinical benefits of yoga and pranayama in managing asthma, particularly in children.
results_summary: The study found that pranayama and yoga can help synchronize and control breathing, reduce hyperventilation, decrease stress and anxiety, boost immunity, and improve respiratory muscle strength in asthma patients. Several clinical trials in children with asthma showed beneficial effects.
population_specificity: Children with asthma.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of Yoga-based lifestyle modification, including Pranayama Breathing, on reducing the severity of obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) in obese patients.
results_summary: The study found that while the yoga group showed a significant reduction in mean AHI (Apnea-Hypopnea Index) within the group, there was no significant difference in mean AHI between the yoga and control groups at one year. However, a higher proportion of patients in the yoga group achieved more than 40% AHI reduction compared to the control group.
population_specificity: Obese patients (BMI >23) diagnosed with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) (AHI >5).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the feasibility of a Yoga programme (including Pranayama Breathing) for preventing type-2 diabetes among high-risk individuals in India.
results_summary: The study assessed feasibility parameters for a larger RCT but did not report specific outcomes for Pranayama Breathing alone. The intervention included Pranayama as part of a broader Yoga programme aimed at T2DM prevention.
population_specificity: Adults aged 18-74 years at high risk of type-2 diabetes (fasting plasma glucose level 5.6-6.9 mmol/L) in India.
effective_dosage: Not specified (part of a structured Yoga programme).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of a short-term yoga-based lifestyle intervention, including Pranayama Breathing, on health-related quality of life (HRQOL) in overweight and obese individuals.
results_summary: The intervention improved overall quality of life and health, with significant increases in physical, psychological, and environmental domain scores. It also led to significant reductions in body weight, BMI, blood pressure, and metabolic markers.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese individuals (BMI ≥23 kg/m²) aged 20-60 years.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the amnesia-reversal activity and safety profile of synthesized compounds, including Pramiracetam, in animal models and human volunteers.
results_summary: Pramiracetam reversed electroconvulsive shock-induced amnesia in mice, exhibited an inverted U-shaped dose-response curve, and was well tolerated in animals and human volunteers. It also showed encouraging activity in patients with primary degenerative dementia.
population_specificity: Mice, normal human volunteers, and patients with primary degenerative dementia (Alzheimer's type).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether yoga, including Pranayama Breathing, improves the quality of life in menopausal women.
results_summary: The study found that 18 weeks of yoga practice, including Pranayama, significantly improved physical, psychological, social, and environmental quality of life domains in menopausal women, with no reported adverse events.
population_specificity: Menopausal women aged 40-60 years in Kattankulathur Block, Kanchipuram District, Tamil Nadu, India.
effective_dosage: 1.5 hours per day for 5 consecutive days (intensive training), followed by 35-40 minutes daily at home and group practice twice weekly.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effect of yoga, including Pranayama Breathing, on negative affective states, cardiovascular function, and cognitive function in post-phase 2 cardiac rehabilitation patients.
results_summary: The study found that yoga, incorporating Pranayama Breathing, reduced negative affective states (anxiety, depression, stress) and improved cardiovascular and cognitive function in cardiac rehabilitation patients. The intervention showed potential as a practical adjunct to standard cardiac rehabilitation programs.
population_specificity: Post-phase 2 cardiac rehabilitation patients
effective_dosage: Two group-based sessions and one self-administered home session per week

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether a yoga intervention, including Pranayama Breathing, improves sleep quality in post-treatment cancer survivors compared to standard care.
results_summary: The study found that participants in the yoga group showed significant improvements in global sleep quality, subjective sleep quality, daytime dysfunction, wake after sleep onset, sleep efficiency, and reduced medication use compared to the standard care group.
population_specificity: Post-treatment cancer survivors (96% female, mean age 54 years, 75% breast cancer) experiencing moderate or greater sleep disruption.
effective_dosage: Two 75-minute sessions per week, including Pranayama Breathing, 16 Gentle Hatha and Restorative yoga asanas, and meditation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether a brief yoga-based lifestyle intervention, including Pranayama Breathing, could reduce stress and inflammation in patients with chronic inflammatory diseases.
results_summary: The study found significant reductions in stress markers (cortisol and β-endorphin) and inflammation markers (IL-6 and TNF-α) after 10 days of the intervention. The results suggest the intervention was effective in improving these outcomes.
population_specificity: Patients with chronic inflammatory diseases and overweight/obese subjects (86 participants, 44 female, 42 male, mean age 40.07 ± 13.91 years).
effective_dosage: Not specified (intervention included asanas, pranayama, stress management, group discussions, lectures, and individualized advice).

study_goal: To evaluate the add-on effects of pranayama and meditation on sleep quality, pain, anxiety, depression, and functional status in Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS) patients undergoing rehabilitation.
results_summary: Pranayama combined with meditation significantly improved sleep quality in GBS patients. Pain, anxiety, and depression scores decreased in both groups, but without significant differences between the yoga and control groups. Functional status improved in both groups without significant differences.
population_specificity: Guillain-Barré syndrome (GBS) patients in a neurological rehabilitation unit.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the efficacy of probiotics, prebiotics, or synbiotics in improving symptoms and quality of life in patients with scleroderma, focusing on gastrointestinal symptoms, SIBO eradication, and lung disease outcomes.
results_summary: The study found very uncertain or minimal effects of probiotics on gastrointestinal symptoms and social functioning, with no significant impact on physical functioning, QoL, or SIBO eradication. No studies addressed prebiotics' effects on interstitial lung disease or pulmonary hypertension.
population_specificity: Patients with systemic scleroderma

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if a 10-week worksite-based yoga program, including Pranayama Breathing, could improve resting heart rate variability (HRV) and related physical and psychological parameters in sedentary office workers.
results_summary: The study found that the yoga program, which included Pranayama Breathing, was designed to improve HRV (a marker of parasympathetic autonomic control) and overall health status, though specific results for Pranayama alone were not detailed in the abstract. The full effects will be measured post-intervention and at 6-month follow-up.
population_specificity: Sedentary office workers
effective_dosage: Three times per week during lunch hour (as part of a broader yoga program)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to examine the preventive and therapeutic roles of prebiotics in managing Small Intestinal Bacterial Overgrowth (SIBO).
results_summary: The study suggests that prebiotics may help modulate gut microbiota and manage SIBO, though the connection between SIBO and conditions like obesity remains unclear. The abstract highlights potential benefits but does not provide specific efficacy data for prebiotics.
population_specificity: General population and individuals with conditions linked to SIBO (e.g., obesity, celiac disease, irritable bowel syndrome).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the impact of prebiotics on estrogen receptor modulation, gut microbiota composition, immune regulation, and metabolic pathways in breast cancer, as well as their potential as adjunctive therapies.
results_summary: Prebiotics were found to modulate the gut microbiota-estrogen axis, reduce inflammation, and influence immune responses. SCFAs derived from prebiotic fermentation demonstrated selective estrogen receptor downregulation and metabolic reprogramming, suppressing tumor growth, while synbiotic interventions mitigated chemotherapy-related side effects.
population_specificity: Breast cancer patients (preclinical and clinical studies).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review the application and potential mechanisms of prebiotics in preventing and managing oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMDs) and gastrointestinal precancerous lesions (GPLs).
results_summary: The study suggests that prebiotics may positively influence the prevention and management of OPMDs and GPLs, though specific efficacy data are not detailed in the abstract. The review explores potential mechanisms and anticipates future clinical applications.
population_specificity: Individuals with oral potentially malignant disorders (OPMDs) and gastrointestinal precancerous lesions (GPLs).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to comprehensively assess the effect of prebiotics, probiotics, and synbiotics on the incidence and severity of atopic dermatitis (AD) in children.
results_summary: The study found that prebiotics, probiotics, and synbiotics significantly reduced the incidence of AD and improved severity scores (SCORAD), particularly with multi-strain probiotics, Lactobacillus, and synbiotics, but not with Bifidobacterium or prebiotics alone. The effect was more pronounced in children with moderate to severe AD.
population_specificity: Children, particularly those with atopic dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the efficacy of probiotics, prebiotics, or synbiotics in restoring microbial diversity and reducing inflammation in cystic fibrosis (CF) patients.
results_summary: The study found no significant improvements in pulmonary function (FEV1), exacerbations, hospitalizations, or quality of life, but noted some reduction in inflammatory markers like fecal calprotectin and proinflammatory interleukins (e.g., IL-6, IL-8). No serious adverse events were reported.
population_specificity: Primarily pediatric populations with cystic fibrosis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effects of four prebiotics and two non-prebiotic carbohydrates on shrimp growth, nutrient composition, biofloc concentration, and bacterial profiles in a biofloc system.
results_summary: Adding prebiotics to the water did not affect shrimp growth but increased lipid content in shrimp muscle with mannan-oligosaccharide. Prebiotics altered bacterial composition in biofloc and shrimp tissues, suggesting potential benefits for shrimp health.
population_specificity: Penaeus vannamei shrimp (6.0 ± 0.5 g) raised in a biofloc technology system.
effective_dosage: 3% of the feed provided, added to the water.
study_duration: 26 days (autotrophic-dominated phase: days 0-4; heterotrophic-dominated phase: days 5-26).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of a prebiotic test product blend on the gut microbiome activity and composition in dogs with soft stools using an in vitro model.
results_summary: The test product increased saccharolytic fermentation, evidenced by higher levels of beneficial metabolites (propionate, acetate, butyrate) and increased abundances of saccharolytic fermenting microbes like Bifidobacterium, while reducing proteolytic bacteria like Proteobacteria.
population_specificity: Canine donors with soft stools (in vitro model).
study_duration: 8-day parallel control/treatment period after 2 days of stabilization.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of fructooligosaccharides (FOS) and other short-chain fatty acids on preventing cholesterol gallstone formation in mice and identify potential gut microbiome and metabolome biomarkers in humans.
results_summary: FOS completely inhibited gallstone formation in mice, and sodium acetate (NaA) also reduced gallstone severity. Gut microbiota and metabolite profiles were distinct in cholesterol gallstone patients, with specific pathways linked to gallstone formation.
population_specificity: Human patients with cholesterol gallstones (30 cases, 30 controls) and male C57BL/6J mice.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of barley malt residue as a raw material for producing xylooligosaccharides (XOS) with prebiotic activity.
results_summary: The study found that microwave-assisted enzymatic hydrolysis of barley malt residue yielded high XOS production (208.05 mg/g substrate), with purification by Saccharomyces cerevisiae being superior. In vitro fermentation showed similar prebiotic activity to commercial XOS and GOS.
population_specificity: In vitro study using selected probiotics (Lactococcus lactis TISTR 1401, Levicaseibacillus brevis FS 2.1, Lactobacillus casei TISTR 1463).
effective_dosage: 89.12 U/g substrate xylanase concentration, 1235.1 W microwave power, 6 min exposure time.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of prebiotic, probiotic, and synbiotic interventions on gut microbiota composition in overweight and obese individuals from Latin American and Caribbean populations.
results_summary: The study found insufficient data to draw definitive conclusions about the effects of biotic treatments on gut microbiota in the studied population, citing variability in outcomes due to differences in supplement formulation, dosage, and methodological heterogeneity.
population_specificity: Overweight and obese participants from Latin American and Caribbean populations (Brazil, Mexico, and Chile).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether probiotic and prebiotic treatments could alleviate dry eye-like symptoms and associated pathological changes in T2DM mice by modulating intestinal microbiota and reducing inflammation.
results_summary: Probiotic and prebiotic treatments alleviated intestinal inflammation, restored barrier function, mitigated lacrimal gland damage, and reduced immune cell infiltration and inflammatory responses in T2DM mice. These effects were linked to inhibition of the TLR4/NF-κB pathway and reshaping of the gut microbial community.
population_specificity: T2DM mice induced by a high-fat diet and streptozotocin injection.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to review current knowledge on the use of prebiotics, probiotics, and postbiotics in treating small intestinal bacterial overgrowth (SIBO).
results_summary: Clinical studies indicated that combining antibiotics with probiotics can enhance SIBO therapy efficacy, particularly in vulnerable populations like children and pregnant women. The abstract suggests a need for better diagnostic methods and understanding of biotics' mechanisms to improve treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Human models, including vulnerable groups such as children and pregnant women.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess whether oral administration of prebiotics (and/or probiotics) improves intestinal iron absorption, hemoglobin, and ferritin levels in children and women of reproductive age.
results_summary: Prebiotics/probiotics showed a modest improvement in iron absorption and ferritin levels in women but no significant effect on hemoglobin levels in women or children. The evidence for these effects varied from low to moderate certainty.
population_specificity: Children and women of reproductive age (WRA).
effective_dosage: Major interventions included galacto-oligosaccharide, inulin, and specific probiotic strains (e.g., Lactobacillus plantarum 299v, Lactobacillus reuteri, Lactobacillus acidophilus), but exact dosages were not specified.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if combining CBT with a prebiotic fiber intervention could improve clinical outcomes in veterans with PTSD and assess its impact on microbiota composition and SCFA levels.
results_summary: The study found that PTSD severity may be linked to reduced propionate-producing taxa and suggested that some individuals with PTSD might benefit from a prebiotic intervention. It also indicated potential for prebiotic supplementation to enhance treatment outcomes.
population_specificity: Veterans with PTSD (n = 70)

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the influence of prebiotics and other biotic agents as adjuvants for the prevention and treatment of infections affecting women's health.
results_summary: The study found that biotic agents, including prebiotics, contribute to a healthy vaginal microbiota through anti-inflammatory and antimicrobial activities, though most clinical studies focused on probiotics rather than prebiotics. Preclinical studies suggested that biotic agents may inhibit pathogens by preventing biofilm formation and microbial adhesion.
population_specificity: Women (focus on vaginal microbiota and related infections).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to investigate the effects of prebiotics, alone or as part of synbiotics, on cardiometabolic parameters in women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS).
results_summary: The study found high-quality evidence supporting prebiotics' effectiveness in reducing body-mass index and diastolic blood pressure, moderate-quality evidence for improvements in weight, waist-to-hip ratio, and triglycerides, and low or very-low-quality evidence for other cardiometabolic parameters. Subgroup analyses suggested additional benefits for LDL reduction with prebiotics and improvements in waist circumference, total cholesterol, and total testosterone with synbiotics.
population_specificity: Women with polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) (n = 1271).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to assess the effectiveness of prebiotic interventions in reducing symptoms of depression and anxiety in psychiatric populations.
results_summary: Prebiotics showed a nonsignificant trend toward reducing depression symptoms (SMD: -0.28; 95% CI: -0.61, 0.04), with no significant effect observed. Only three trials examined prebiotics for depression, limiting conclusive findings.
population_specificity: Psychiatric populations with clinical depression or anxiety symptoms.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine the effects of prebiotics and iron fortificants on liver and renal function tests in women of reproductive age.
results_summary: The study found that prebiotic and iron-fortified diets increased ALT, AST, and total bilirubin levels, with varying effects depending on the combination of prebiotics and iron fortificants used. The highest increases in liver and renal markers were observed in specific treatment groups, indicating potential dose-dependent effects.
population_specificity: Women of reproductive age (WRA) with iron deficiency.
effective_dosage: 963 mg/kg GOS + 15 ppm FeSO4; 963 mg/kg Inulin + 20 ppm NaFeEDTA; 963 mg/kg GOS + 30 ppm FeSO4.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to analyze the potential role of prebiotics in preventing viral infections like Covid-19 and promoting antiviral immunity, focusing on their immunomodulatory and anti-inflammatory effects.
results_summary: The abstract suggests limited evidence for prebiotics' efficacy in viral infections, with unknown mechanisms for systemic immune modulation. Some probiotics showed immunomodulatory and antiviral effects, but data on prebiotics remain scarce and inconclusive.
population_specificity: In vitro studies on colon cells, in vivo studies on mice, and some clinical trials involving different age groups.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether coating Lactobacillus plantarum with β-glucan prebiotic could enhance its survival in the GI tract and improve its therapeutic efficacy for ulcerative colitis.
results_summary: The study found that the β-glucan-coated probiotic (Lp@CGN) showed a 276-fold increase in survival rate under GI conditions, effectively alleviated UC symptoms, restored intestinal barriers, regulated inflammatory cytokines, and promoted SCFA production.
population_specificity: Preclinical models (preventative and therapeutic UC models).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the impact of prebiotic supplementation on insulin resistance and hormonal parameters in women with PCOS.
results_summary: Prebiotic supplementation showed improvements in insulin resistance (reductions in HOMA-IR, fasting glucose, and insulin) and hormonal balance (increased SHBG, decreased total testosterone), though synbiotics had more pronounced effects.
population_specificity: Overweight or obese women aged 15 to 48 with PCOS, diagnosed according to the Rotterdam criteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the role of prebiotics on the gut microbiome diversity of severe acute malnourished (SAM) children and assess secondary outcomes like weight gain and neurodevelopment.
results_summary: The abstract does not provide specific results but indicates the study will generate high-quality data on the effects of RUTF plus prebiotics on gut microbiome diversity and other health metrics in SAM children.
population_specificity: Severe acute malnourished (SAM) children aged 6-59 months.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the evidence on prebiotics' role in promoting cognitive functioning and propose recommendations for future research, focusing on cognitive resilience under taxing conditions.
results_summary: Existing studies show limited effects of prebiotics on cognitive functioning under basal conditions. The authors suggest investigating prebiotics' potential to enhance cognitive resilience under stress, poor sleep, sedentary behavior, and unhealthy diets.
population_specificity: Predominantly healthy participants under basal conditions, with recommendations to include vulnerable populations facing cognition-taxing factors.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to explore the potential of prebiotics and other microbiota-modulating supplements in addressing dysbiosis and chronic inflammatory diseases like IBD.
results_summary: The abstract suggests that prebiotics, along with probiotics, paraprobiotics, and postbiotics, may modify gut microbiota composition and improve microbiome effects, potentially offering new treatment avenues for IBD. However, specific efficacy data for prebiotics alone are not detailed.
population_specificity: Individuals with chronic inflammatory diseases such as IBD (ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether agarooligosaccharides (AOS) could selectively inhibit pathogenic bacteria (R. gnavus and F. nucleatum) while preserving beneficial bacteria (Bifidobacteria and Lactobacillales).
results_summary: AOS significantly inhibited the growth of R. gnavus and F. nucleatum, altered their fatty acid biosynthesis, and promoted B. longum dominance in co-culture. In vivo studies showed reduced levels of pathogenic bacteria and associated genes.
population_specificity: Mice (in vivo) and bacterial cultures (in vitro).
effective_dosage: 0.1% and 0.2% AOS for bacterial inhibition; 0.2% and 2% AOS for testing effects on beneficial bacteria.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to compare the efficacy of prebiotics, probiotics, and synbiotics in improving symptoms of chronic functional constipation.
results_summary: Prebiotics improved stool consistency and gastrointestinal symptoms, including abdominal pain, gastroesophageal reflux, and constipation symptoms, with statistically significant results. The greatest improvements were observed in active treatment groups compared to placebo.
population_specificity: 74 patients diagnosed with chronic functional constipation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine whether UV-treated riboflavin could effectively attenuate atopic dermatitis (AD) progression by modulating immune responses, particularly through NLRP3 inflammasome inhibition.
results_summary: UV-treated riboflavin significantly reduced AD progression in a mouse model by suppressing NLRP3 inflammasome activation, decreasing IL-1β secretion and TSLP production, and directly inhibiting inflammatory cytokine expression in keratinocytes. NLRP3 activation partially reversed these effects, confirming its central role.
population_specificity: MC903-induced mouse model of atopic dermatitis.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and development of riboflavin-based corneal collagen cross-linking (CXL) for treating corneal ectasia, including keratoconus.
results_summary: The study found that riboflavin photochemical activation with UV-A light effectively increases corneal biomechanical stability and halts progressive ectasia, with recent innovations enhancing clinical effectiveness and safety. Long-term follow-up data supported the method's dominance in treating corneal ectasia.
population_specificity: Patients with keratoconus and other corneal ectasias.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the potential of AAV9-SLC52A2 gene therapy to rescue RTD Type 2 patient-derived motoneurons by restoring riboflavin transporter function.
results_summary: The study found that AAV9-SLC52A2 gene therapy significantly increased neurite length in RTD motoneurons compared to untreated samples, suggesting a potential therapeutic benefit for RTD patients.
population_specificity: RTD Type 2 patient-derived motoneurons (rare childhood-onset neurodegenerative disorder caused by SLC52A2 mutations).

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of riboflavin therapy in patients with late-onset MADD-like myopathy and assess potential causative factors.
results_summary: All cases showed variable improvement following riboflavin therapy, alongside nutritional advice and sertraline discontinuation. The study suggests that late-onset MADD-like myopathy may be more common than primary genetic MADD, with non-genetic factors potentially playing a role.
population_specificity: Patients attending the West of Scotland neuromuscular service with a working diagnosis of late-onset MADD (median onset age 52 years, female predominance).
interactions: Sertraline use was noted in 16/19 cases, with advice given on discontinuation.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to evaluate riboflavin's potential as a 17β-hydroxysteroid dehydrogenase antagonist for prostate cancer therapy, comparing its inhibitory activity and stability to standard drugs.
results_summary: Riboflavin showed high binding energy (-10.918 kcal/mol) and stability, outperforming the standard drug docetaxel (-7.374 kcal/mol). It also had a better induce fit score (-722.37 kcal/mol) and pharmacokinetic profile compared to docetaxel.
population_specificity: In silico (computational) study, no human or animal subjects.

study_goal: The researchers aimed to determine if combining iontophoresis of riboflavin with femtosecond-generated epithelial microchannels could enhance stromal riboflavin delivery and crosslinking efficacy while reducing procedure time.
results_summary: The study found that combining iontophoresis with microchannels significantly increased stromal riboflavin concentration (threefold) and collagen autofluorescence intensity (fourfold) compared to iontophoresis alone, achieving results equivalent to microchannels alone but in a shorter time.
population_specificity: Ex vivo rabbit eyes and in vivo rabbits.
effective_dosage: Not specified (topical iso-osmolar riboflavin solution used).

study_goal: To evaluate the investigational use of riboflavin-based corneal crosslinking (CXL) for treating corneal neovascularization (CNV) in various scenarios, including with or without infection.
results_summary: CXL with riboflavin was successful in 24 of 38 cases, particularly in postkeratoplasty corneal melting, infectious keratitis, and combined keratoplasty scenarios, but showed limited benefit in cases with ongoing CNV stimuli like chronic conditions or unresolved infection.
population_specificity: 35 participants (37 eyes) with corneal neovascularization, including postkeratoplasty cases and active infections.
study_duration: Single treatment session (30-minute or accelerated 10-minute irradiation), with some cases receiving repeat treatments.
